The patient has no history of stroke or transient ischemic attack. His father experienced a debilitating stroke several years ago, and when he learns that his atrial fibrillation places him at higher risk for a stroke, he is visibly distressed.IntroductionThe concepts of evidence-based medicine are evolving as limitations of early models are addressed.
